intro: Diplotaxis virgata var. euvirgata, commonly known as the African dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant produces bright yellow composite flowers that bloom in spring, followed by fluffy seed heads resembling dandelion seeds. It has a taproot system and thrives in well-drained soils, making it adaptable to various arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture.
